data.auto_shade: Enable this to activate cover control by sun. You need to fill in all below configuration to use this!
data.azimut: The Azimut when the cover will be in sun
data.buildingDeviation: The deviation of the building (you can think of it like which side of the building)
data.control_entity: The Entity to control this input. Only required if set Control Type to Entity above.
data.control_type: Control the Input, Can be True/False to set it permanently or point to a boolean entity to have it dynamic.
data.elevation: The Elevation when the cover will be in sun
data.elevation_10to20: Position to send when in elevation between 10 and 20 (0)
data.elevation_20to30: Position to send when in elevation between 20 and 30 (0)
data.elevation_30to40: Position to send when in elevation between 30 and 40 (0)
data.elevation_40to50: Position to send when in elevation between 40 and 50 (0)
data.elevation_50to60: Position to send when in elevation between 50 and 60 (0)
data.elevation_gt60: Position to send when in elevation > 60 (0)
data.name: Input Name
data.offset_entry: An offset for when we conside the need to have shadow (-90 to 0) and the sun is entering the window.
data.offset_exit: An offset for when we conside the need to have shadow (0 to 90) and the sun is leaving the window.
data.setIfInShadow: Inverts the function, only triggers if we consider the window to be in the shadow
data.shadow: Position to send when in Shadow (0)
data.sun_entity: The entity we use to track the sun. Usually sun.sun
data.updateInterval: How often should we recalculate in minutes. Have this too small will make the cover move constantly!
data.value: The value the Input should send. Use this to send a fixed value. Only one can be used other should be empty (Value/Value Entity/Value Template)
data.value_entity: The entity that should be used to get the value from to send. Only one can be used other should be empty (Value/Value Entity/Value Template)
data.value_template: The value template that should be used to get the value from to send. Only one can be used other should be empty (Value/Value Entity/Value Template)
data.value_type: The type of Input you want to use.

add.description: Here you can define all properties for an input. Not all values are required and some are mutual exclusive!
add.title: Input {input_name} Step 1/2

data.value_entity: The entity that should be used to get the value from to send.

add_input_entity.description: Here you can define the value entity for an input.
add_input_entity.title: Input {input_name} Step 2/2

data.value: The value the Input should send. Use this to send a fixed value.

add_input_fixed.description: Here you can define the fixed value for an input.
add_input_fixed.title: Input {input_name} Step 2/2
